main event: On January 19, 1953, a small round object with a flashing red light was observed over Mecca, Indiana for a duration of 6 minutes.
interesting points: The object emitted no sound during the sighting., The observer reported that the object turned sharply north and disappeared., The sighting lasted for a total of 6 minutes., The object was noted to be very bright, causing difficulty in looking at it directly., The report suggests that the observers likely only saw the navigation light of the object.
sighted object: small round object with flashing red light
witness description: civilian witness with a clear view of the night sky
